gurmukhi: kMTih kpoiq liK kop kIn ] nwsw inhwr bin kIr lIn ] romwvl hyr jmnw irswn ] l`jw mrMq swgr fubwn ]17]
transliteration: Kanthah(i) Kapot(i) Lakh(i) Kop Keen|| Naasaa Nihaar Ban(i) Keer Leen||romaaval Her Jammaa Risaan|| Lajjaa Marant Saagad Doubaan||17||
translation: Seeing her neck, the female pigeon got enraged and the parrot seeing her nostril hid himself in the forest; seeing her hair, even Yamuna was filled with anger and seeing her serenity, the ocean felt shy.17.

gurmukhi: bwhU iblok lwjY miRnwl ] iKisXwn hMs Aivlok cwl ] jMGw iblok kdlI ljwn ] insrwt Awp Git rUp mwn ]18]
transliteration: Baahoo Bilok Laajai Mrinaal|| Khisiyaan Hans Avilok Dhaal|| Janhaa Bilok Kadlilajaan|| Nisraat Aap Ghattee Roop Maan||18||
translation: Seeing her arms, the lotus-stalk felt she and the swans, seeing her gait got angry; seeing her legs, the Kadli trees became shyful and the moon considered his beauty inferior to her.18.

gurmukhi: ieh BwNiq qws brxo iSMgwr ] ko skY kib mihmw aucwr ] AYsI srUp Aivlok AqR ] jnu lIn rUp ko CIn CqR ]19]
transliteration: Eh Bhaant(i) Taas Barno Shingadr|| Ko Sakai Kabi Mahimaa Ouchaar|| Aisisaroop Avilok Atra|| Jan(u) Leen Roop Ko Chheen Chhatra||19||
translation: In this way, the charm of her beauty is described, and no poet can utter her greatness; seeing such a beauteous lady, the sage Atri believed that he had obtained canopied kingdom of beauty.19.

gurmukhi: kInI pRq`ig iqh smY nwr ] bXwhY n Bog BogY Bqwr ] mY brO qws ruc mwn ic`q ] jo shY kSt AYso piv`q ]20]
transliteration: Keenipratagg(i) Tih Samai Naar|| Byaahai Nab Hog Bhogad Bhataar|| Mai Barau Taas Rouch Maan Chitt|| Jo Sahai Kasht Aiso Pavitt||20||
translation: That lady had vowed that she would not marry her husband for sexual enjoyment, and would wed that person, who would have the strength to endure the sacred tribulations of austrerities.20.

gurmukhi: irK mwn bYn qb brXo jwih ] jnu lIn lUt sINgwr qwih ] lY gXo Dwm kir nwr qaun ] ipq d`q dyv mun AqR jaun ]21]
transliteration: Rikh Maan Bain Tab Barno Jaah(i)|| Jan(u) Leen Loot Seegadr Taah(i)|| Lai Gado Dhaam Kar(i) Taar Taoun|| Pit Datt Dev Mounndatra Jaoun||21||
translation: The sage (Arti) had agreed with her vow and married her and sacrificed himself on her charm of beauty; he, the sage Atri, who was the father of Dattatreya, making her his wife, brought her home.21.

gurmukhi: bhu brK bIq ik`no ibvwih ] iek BXo Awn AaurY auCwih ] iqh gey Dwm bHmwid Awid ] ik`nI su syv qRIXAn pRswid ]22]
transliteration: Bahu Barakh Beet Kinno Bivaah(i)|| Ik Bhayo Aan Aurai Ouchhaad(i)|| Tih Gad Dhaam Brahmaadh Aadh|| Kinnisu Sev Treeyan Prasaadh||22||
translation: Several years passed after marriage and once an opportunity arose when Brahma and other gods went to the home of that sage; the women of the hermitage of the sage performed great service to them.22.

gurmukhi: bhu DUp dIp Aru ArG dwn ] pwdriG Awid ik`ny sujwn ] Avlok Bgiq iqh cqur bwk ] ieMdRwid ibSn bYTy ipnwk ]23]
transliteration: Bahu Dhoop Deep Ar(u) Aragh Daan|| Paadargh(i) Aadh Kinne Sujaan|| Avlok Bhagad(i) Tih Chatur Baak|| Indraadh Bishan Baithe Pinaak||23||
translation: The incense was burnt, the lamps were lighted, there were libations and salutations; seeing Indra, Vishnu and Shiva, all the devotees eulogized them.23.

gurmukhi: Avlok Bgq Bey irK pRsMn ] jo iqhU m`iD lokwin DMn ] ik`no su AYs bHmw aucwr ] qYN puqÍMq hUjo kumwr ]24]
transliteration: Avlok Bhagad Bhae Rich Prasann|| Jo Tihoo Maddh(i) Lokaan(i) Dhann|| Kinno Su Ais Brahmaa Ouchaar|| Tain Poutravant Hoojo Koumaar||24||
translation: Seeing the devotion of the sage, all were pleased and all blessed him; then Brahma said, “O Kumar! You will be blessed with a son.”24.

gurmukhi: kIA AYs bHm aucwr ] qYN pwvs bwr ] qb nwr ey sun bYn ] bhu Awsu fwrq nYn ]25]
transliteration: Keea Ais Brahm Ouchaar|| Tain Poutra Paavas Baar|| Tab Naar E Soun Bain|| Bahu Aas(u) Daarat Nain||25||
translation: When Brahma said this that the save would be blessed with a son, then listening to it, her eyes showed signs of anxiety.25.

gurmukhi: qb bwl ibkl srIr ] jl sÍq nYn ADIr ] romwNic gd gd bYn ] idn qy deI jnu rYn ]26]
transliteration: Tab Baal Bikal Dareer|| Jal Sravat Nain Adheer|| Romaanch(i) Gad Gad Bain|| Din Te Daijan(u) Rain||26||
translation: The body of that young lady became agitated and the tears flowed form her eyes; she was filled with anxiety on hearing these words and she felt that the day had changed into night.26.

gurmukhi: romwNic ibkl srIr ] qn kop mwn ADIr ] PrkMq austru nYn ] ibn bu`iD bolq bYn ]27]
transliteration: Romaanch(i) Bikal Dareer|| Tan Kop Maan Adheer|| Pharkant Oustat(u) Nain|| Bin Buddh(i) Dolat Bain||27
translation: Her body was agitated with anxiety and she getting enraged, became impatient, lips and eyes quivered and she lamented.27.

gurmukhi: suin AYs bYn ] miRgIeys nYn ] Aiq rUp Dwm ] suMdr su bwm ]28]
transliteration: Soun(i) Ais Bain|| Mrigeees Nain|| At(i) Roop Dhaam|| Soundar Su Baam||28||
translation: Hearing these words that doe-eyed and extremely beautiful lady (felt agitated).28.
